Linda Yaccarino was recently hired as Twitter's chief executive by Elon Musk. She is prevented from working on a key component of her job due to a contractual agreement with her former employer, NBCUniversal. Despite this, she has been working on repairing relationships between Twitter and Google, talking with regulators, and focusing on employee morale. She has also been rallying workers with mission statements and more internal communication. Ms. Yaccarino has also addressed the state of Twitter's advertising, acknowledging that some big brands have stayed away from the platform and saying that she and other sales employees would have to engage in "hand-to-hand combat" to persuade them to return. Despite the restrictions, Ms. Yaccarino is still optimistic and believes that they are on the precipice of making history.

  1. Linda Yaccarino is the new CEO of Twitter.
  2. She initially could not take ad sales meetings due to a noncompete clause.
  3. She has been working on repairing relationships between Twitter and Google, talking with regulators, and focusing on employee morale.
  4. Twitter's U.S. ad revenue has fallen nearly 60 percent.
  5. She has been engaging in "hand-to-hand combat" to persuade big brands to return to the platform.
